availability.licence: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

correction.p: OCR generated transcript has not been corrected.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

A TRIBUTE
published In the pages of
THE CORNING LEADER
CORNING, N. Y.
APR 1 0 1971
m
^nLtn^d ̂ nta fR-c^
MRS. FRED MOSHER
^ Mrs. Alice H. Mosher, 65, of
2303 Inglewood Drive, Wil
mington, Dela., a former
Hornby teacher, died Thursday
at her home, following an ex
tended iDness.
Born in Hornby Sept. 3, 1905,
she was the daughter of Elmer
and Anne McLaughlin Harrison.
She married Fred C. Mosher
July 3, 1933 in the Grace Epis
copal Church rectory in Earls-
viUe'.
Mrs. Mosher was raised in
Hornby and attended local
schools. She was a graduate of
Geneseo Normal School. She
taught for several years in
Hornby.
After leaving here, she moved
to Hamilton and later to Earls-
ville where she taught for 30
years.
She and her husband moved to
Wilmington, Dela., in February
to be near their son, Barry.
Mrs. Mosher was a member
of the Daughters of the Amer-
lican Revolution Chapter at
E^rlsville and Grace Episcopal
[church in Earlsville.
Surviving are her husband,
Fred; a son, Barry Mosher, cjf
Wilmington and two grand
children.
Funeral services were held
this morning at the Chandler
Funeral Hmme, in Wilmington,
Dela. Interment will be in
Elwood Memorial Park in Olins
Mills, Pa.

A Permanent Record ot the
Obituary and Funeral Details
MRS. FRED C. MOSHER
WILMINGTON, DEL. —
Mrs. Alice IJ. Mosher, 65,
wife of Frederick C. Mosher,
died Thursday, April 8, in
Wilmington.
She was bom in Hornby,
the daughter of Elmer and
Anne (McLaughlin) Har
rison. She was a resident of
and taught school in Hornby,
moving to the Mid-York area
in 1935.
For 30 years she lived be
tween Hamilton and Earl-
ville and taught in the Eiarl-
ville Central School for 20
years. She was a member of
the DAR and Grace Episcopal
Church, Earlville.
The Moshers moved to
Wilmington in February of
this year.
Besides her husband, she is
survived by a son, Barry R.
Mosher, Wilmington and two
grandchildren.
Funeral services were held
on April 10 in the Chandler
Funeral Home, Wilmington,
with interment in Edgewood
Memorial Park, Glen Mills,
Pa.
rtainsiora, neaim uiiicer lor
the Town of Madison, will
hold his monthly immuniza
tion clinic on April 21.
Monthly clinics are held the
third Wednesday of each
month through June in the
American Legion Hall on
Lake Moraine Road in Mad
ison at 9 a. m.
Dr. Rainsford brings to
the parents attention that the
present New York State law
requires all children to have
completed adequate doses of

rubella and polio before

PURCHASE AGREEMENT
EDGEWOOD MEMORIAL PARK COMPANY
EDGEWOOD MEMORIAL PARK COMPANY, a corporation. Seller, agrees to sell to
for
Purchaser(s), the rights of sepulture
2" _ graves, and to issue a deedor burial in Lot No. ^ C Unit ^ Section
therefor, when the conditions of this Agreement have been fulfilled.
Purchaser(s) agree to pay ^ ^
Dollars therefor, payable as follows: $ —~ herewith; $ ̂ l/S'o^ ,-+9^ ~
and the balance in monthly installments of $ — , due and payable on the " day of each month
thereafter until all said payments are made in full, with interest at the rate of 6% per annum on the unpaid balance, be
ginning twelve months after date hereof. Installment payments may be made in advance.
Purchaser(s) agree that 15% of the full purchase price shall be deposited in the Perpetual Care Trust Fund, to
be held in trust in perpetuity, together with other funds likewise deposited, the net income therefrom, to be used for the
general care and maintenance of the above described lot and/or of Edgewood Memorial Park as a whole, the lots, roadways,
walks, pavements, drainage and water systems, buildings, etc.
This Agreement and the Deed to be given hereafter are made subject to all Rules and Regulations and By-laws of
Edgewood Memorial Park Company and/or of the Perpetual Care Trust Fund, now in force or which hereafter may be
adopted and such Rules and Regulations and By-laws are incorporated and made part of this Agreement, as if herein set
forth.
Purchaser(s) shall, by this Agreement or by the Deed, acquire only the rights of sepulture or burial of the re
mains of human persons. No Deed shall be executed and delivered to Purchaser(s) unless and until the purchase price
has been paid in full and no interment shall be permitted in the said lot until payment of an amount sufficient to cover
the portion of the lot to be used, as determined by Seller. T||iilot may be exchanged, at the option of Purchaser(s) pro
vided no interment has been made therein, for similar space of same value.
This Agreement shall not be recorded in any public office and may not be assigned by Purchaser(s) without the
written consent of Seller.
Time is of the essence of this agreement. In the event of default in making said payments, which default shall
occur when the equivalent of at least two monthly payments are due and owing, ̂ ller shall have the right, in addition
to all other remedies and rights given it by law, to declare this Agreement forfeited and all payments made hereunder may
be retained by it as liquidated damages and it may dispose of the said lot or any unused portion thereof as though this
Agreement had never been entered into.
The entire agreement between the parties is set forth herein and no collateral or oral agreements or understandings
shall be binding on Seller unless reduced to writing signed by an officer of Seller and attached to this agreement.
This agreement shall inure to the benefit of and be binding upon the successors and assigns of Seller, and the
heirs, executors and administrators of Purchaser(s).
Dated this day ofday of A.D. 19 7 /
EDGEWOOD MEMORIAL PARK COMPANY
By
CUix^ •
Purchaser(s)

Sales Office: Globe 9'3454 Business Office: Globe 9^2500
EDGEWOOD MEMORIAL PARK
GLEN MILLS, PA. 19342
April 9, 1971
Mr, Frederick ̂ osher
2303 Inglewood Drive
Wilmington, Delaware I9803
Dear Mr, Mosiier:
On behalf of the Board of Directors of the Edgewood
Memorial Park Company, permit me to extend our sympathy with you
in your bereavement. We want you to know that we feel you have
entrusted to us a sacred duty which we regard a continuing obliga
tion to be fulfilled throughout the years to come.
During the growing season, there are a number of cutting
beds of hardy flowers which are available for placing on graves at
no cost whatever to lotowners and their friends. If you wish to gather
some at any time, cutting shears may be had on request at the office.
Sincerely yours,
EDG-EliTOOD IiiEMOEIAL PARK COMPANY
'M
(Mrs, W, 0, Staton)
jfs
P,S, A family "Historical Record" form is kept on file at the
office and within a few days, a representative will call upon you
in order to complete this information.
ov -
CERTIFICATION AND ASSIGNMENT
I, Frederick C» Mosher, of 2303 Inglewood Drive, Fairfax
V/ilmington, Delaware, do hereby certify that I am the person
who purchased two graves in Section I, Lot 66, Unit A-3-4, in
Edgewooa Memorial Park on March 20, 1971, covered by Edgewood
Memorial Park Contract E-409, a deed for this lot has not as
yet been issued, and that no one but myself has any right, title
or interest in these two graves#
It is my desire that the two graves in the above mentioned
Lot No# 66, Unit A-3-4, uection I be exchanged for Lot No# 66,
Unit A, Graves #5 and 6 in Section I, and that the deed be issued,
for these two graves.
IN V/ITNESS WHEREOF I have this
1971 oat my hand and seal.

MORTICIANS SINCE 1692
JAMES T. CHANDLER & SON, INC.
2506 CONCORD PIKE. WILMINGTON. DELAWARE 19803
lOIl JEFFERSON STREET
302-6S4-3I41
May 10, ]971
Mr, Barry R. Mosher
1303 Foulk Road
Windsor Hills
Wilmington,Delaware 19803
Dear Mr, Moshers
Our statement is enclosed. We realize that it has been
discussed with you previously, however if there is any
thing that is not clear, please give us a call so that
we may clarify the matter for you.
Above all, we wish to thank you for your confidence in
our firm. We all sincerely hope that everything was as
you desired for our intentions always are to serve you
and your family to the best of our abilities.
Thank you again 1
Sincerely,
J. T. Chandler,III
Secretary and Treasurer
enc.
